description:
I've been looking for a coffee shop with good (but affordable-ish) drinks, tables, outlets, and fast+reliable WiFi and Tierra Mia checks all that off. There are tables inside and outside, reasonably spaced from each other. I got the Horchatta Latte with non-fat milk. It was good - a little too sweet for my taste, however. 

Tip: ask barista for key to bathroom.
author: Thu P.

description:
I've walked by this spot every time I walk on this part of Mission Street, but my inner clock was not dialed to coffee time until recently when I actually entered the cafe on a whim. I've actually been to the other Tierra Mia on Broadway in Oakland to meet a former colleague, but I threw balls to the wall and ordered one of their specialties, the sweeter than sweet Horchata Frappe (review: http://bit.ly/2xrOCDY). I noticed they serve that sugary confection here, but I tried to hold the reins tighter by ordering an 8-oz Cappuccino Italiano since it was a coolish afternoon even though I know it's a major faux pas to have cappuccino after 12 Noon (photo: http://bit.ly/2OEQT5O). I didn't get grief for my order, but I certainly got plenty of sugar as it was a most dessert-like drink for the middle of the afternoon. The chill vibe in here helped me nurse it before I tossed half of it away. No offense to the barista but it wasn't quite my taza de the.

COFFEE - 3 stars...a stellar cappuccino if you want something for dessert
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...relaxing vibe on this particularly urban stretch of Mission
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...nice crew here
TOTAL - 3 stars...just sweeter than I wanted...or needed

RELATED - Looking for dining options in Bernal Heights? Here's a collection of places I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2MMXXMk
author: Ed U.

description:
I was glad to have stumbled upon this coffee place while waiting for oil change for my car. I've heard about Tierra Mia a couple times from my coffee-loving friend. 

I ordered the small coco loco latte, and even the small cup was kinda big for me. The chocolate taste really blended in well in the drink. I really enjoyed every slurp from the cup. 

The place itself was very spacious and comfy for hanging out or working. Highly recommended!
author: Nathania Y.

description:
Tierra Mia Coffee, we meet again. Only this time, I am happy and content with my vanilla latte. It's flavorful but wasn't as hot as I liked it to be. It was pretty much lukewarm. 

I've been to Tierra Mia in Oakland and geez it was a nightmare. I was a bit hesitant to grab a cup of Joe here but heck, everyone deserves a second chance. 

The barista was really nice and the place is really cute! I love how they have small enclosed patio out back. I can tell, this place caters to a good relaxing experience. 

Have you measured out your life with coffee spoons? Cause I have. 

Solid 4 stars for me.
author: Shannen R.

description:
Dropped off my boyfriend's mom at the hospital across the street and was looking for a coffee shop to pass some time. Stumbled upon this place. It was cute and homey feeling. Upon entering, there wasn't really anyone to greet me. Took them a while to notice I was there. She was nice when she came up to the register though. The whole ordering process had a feeling of confusion floating between me and the cashier. Not a big deal though. 

I ordered the Horchata Frappe with a shot of espresso added. MmMMmm good. The order came out about three minutes after I ordered it. It was caked in a nice wallop of whipped cream on top. The first sip was bomb oh my goodness so good. It really was an amazing first sip! As time progressed however, I found myself getting overwhelmed by it. It took quite some effort to drink. Maybe ordering a medium for myself wasn't the best idea. I'd be more than elated to come back and order it again in a size small! 

I was also recommended to try the Coco Loco. My friend isn't a coconut fan and neither am I, but she said that it was really good. So, I'll have to come back for that!
author: Kim N.

description:
One of my favorite coffee shops in the city! Great flavor and made to order. If you want something on the sweeter side definitely try their horchata latte and frappe. It is delicious!! 

4 stars because I feel coffee shops should open early in order to serve the working people, and morning coffee drinkers. Unfortunately they do not open until 8, when most people start, or on their way to work. Otherwise if you are in the neighborhood you should stop n try it!
author: Manny R.

description: Great place for a study spot. Not too loud and crowded. Outlets almost everywhere. Horchata frappe is strongly recommended if you're a frappe fan. Staffs were nice.
author: Kat P.

description:
Oh my gosh! This place is amazing! I came here recently on a Saturday afternoon and there was a good amount of people here (no lines)! I ordered the horchata frap because everyone raves about it. My boyfriend who has never heard of this place or about the horchata frap they have LOVED it too. He ordered the Mexican mocha which was also bomb. So delicious! 

This cafe is for sure underrated compare to other cafes in the city. Definitely will come back and try the other items! 

Parking isn't the best since it is metered but I found parking on Valencia. Close to bus stops as well.
author: Joyce S.

description: Amazing! Pastries are delightful! My favorite is their almond croissant with almond custard filling, divine! Love their Latin twist on typical drinks and pastries. A must try!
author: Mas M.

description:
I. AM. SO. IMPRESSED! First, it's such a fun and chill atmosphere. Second, the coffee is legitimately very good. I got the Horchatta Frappe and my mom got the cubano. Bothe were so good. The Horchatta is not grainy at all, and tastes so good with their blend of coffee. My mom said the cubano was perfectly smooth and sweet. 

There is a restroom available to customers and there is plenty of seating around the shop. I will definitely be frequenting this place when my mom's company moves into their new building down the street! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: Nikki G.

description: I was so happy to find Tierra Mia in San Francisco. There is 2 hour parking in close proximity. Tierra Mia has a rustic scheme and a good middle ground between a bar in the SOMA and a local roaster. The barista guy happened to wear a white dress shirt which makes it seem like he was a server at a fancy restaurant. I decided to go with the horchata cream blend instead of the horchata latte today. I didn't realize there was such a huge difference between the two. Nonetheless, still good and still Tierra Mia quality. I think it would be cool if they had booths here but there's a Burger King and many diners close by. Its a great place to work on your laptop. The WiFi info is near the cashier. I tend to always end up getting up to look at the WiFi information again. Snapping a quick pic does the trick for me. Now that I know how the parking situation is like I will most likely be back more often.
author: Jennifer Z.

description: Would've enjoyed visiting here if the girl cashier didn't mug us and rolled her eyes at my friend and I.  Overall, good drinks.
author: Jojo P.

description: I stopped by Tierra Mia with my cousin early this morning. I am a huge Mazapan fan and I must say, I fell in love with their Mazapan Frappe! The flavors were on point! I also tried many horchata drinks and usually only taste like cinnamon or milk. But the horchata frappe was delicious and actually tasted like horchata. I would definitely come here again.
author: Maribel O.

description: Great coffeeshop, it has a lot of sunshine and on a perfect corner triangle shaped. I liked the quietness and plenty of working spaces in there plus both indoor and outdoor sittings, overall if you're looking for a good cafe for work, this is it.
author: Jay G.

description: 4 starts only because the WiFi kept crashing like 6 times during the time I was there (2 hours). But a great café, delicious Latte and a very nice and professional staff! Overall very clean (bathroom as well).
author: Gia M.

description: First time at this particular location! I've had the horchata latte at the Oakland location before hot and iced, I remembered liking the iced one better. I ordered the horchata latte with almond milk iced, but received it hot. All good tho! It was good and the almond milk substitution was recommended by the barista, I think it did make the drink that much better!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Tierra Mia Coffee has pastries, probably sammies, lattes,
only needed coffee to keep me awake on an hot day

brew: Hondruas, La Paz (m. 3.45)
-bold, slightly bitter, that's ok
i like the boldness.

drips: 
-quick service,
-curious only can enter/exit from front. 
no doubt a security issue....
just an headsup.
author: Victor G.

description:
The drip coffee is good and strong enough to keep me awake in the morning but on the weak side. Priced competitively but not exactly cheap, uses good quality beans. The service is quick and the times I've gone haven't been crowded. I stick to drip coffee and espressos, so can't speak to their more creative offerings. Food wise, they carry standard savory and sweet pastries like croissants, scones, etc. They accept credit cards.

I really like the ambiance - the furnishings are austere but feel sturdy and welcoming with lots natural light from windows. It's a very spacious coffee shop with lots of indoor seating for groups, individuals. You can have a quiet conversation but it's not too hushed for work sessions if you can keep it down. I'll definitely come again to catch up with friends or for a quiet afternoon work session.
author: Truc N.

description: Their horchata frappe is so delish with the right amount of sugar and spice and all the things nice. I also tried their rice & bean frappe - not that huge of a fan bc of the texture so I'll just stick with what I know :).
author: Jenna L.

description:
Spazzed with their Horchata latte! It's full of spices and yum! 

I'm sure their other caffeinated drinks are mighty delicious! 

I adore the outdoor seating with coffee in hand and wifi on board! 

A full on cafe and efficient cafe to get errands done!
author: Tiffany D.

description: BEST HORCHATA FRAP EVER !!!!! I'm so obsessed with this drink it's so amazing ! My friend told me to try this spot out bc he knows I love horchata and I'm so happy I did :) we live on the other side of the city but it's so worth the drive . Parking suck at this location but just be patient :) my bf enjoyed the horchata latte as well . We never come early enough but I want to try their guava pastry.
author: Monica M.

description:
Finally got to try Horchata Latte and Horchata Frappe and happy I did! Both the latte and Frappe tasted the same but the latte i got was hot. It was delicious!!

Service was also pleasant and quick. Batista's there were helpful. Will definitely go back to try their other drinks!
author: Carmina D.

description:
Came to the city on February 11th and felt like a pick me up before I left town. It was about 545, and it was about to close but I just had to try Tierra Mia because everyone talks about it. I drove literally out of the way just for this, so it had better be good.

The parking is...well it's SF there is hardly any parking. I pulled up to a red light and made my boyfriend get out, he was highly irritated but all I could yell was "get me the biggest size horchata frappe!!!!" Before he slammed my door. 

I waited about 10 minutes then the boyfriend shows up at the car (i parked at the bank just a short walk), and all he keeps saying is "wow, wow, wow" about 10 times. He told me it was awesome, now my turn...OH EM GEE! Freaking fantastic! I wish they had one closer, but the flavor was amazing! I highly recommend!
author: Erica C.

description: I'm back in the bossom of SF and one of my favorite things to do when I get here is to have a horchata latte.  Yeah it's kinda gimmicky but I love it.  I like that this place's beans are really smooth and rich.  It's like having a mouth full of satin sheets.....If that makes any sense at all (it doesn't).  It's probably pretty hard to park your car around here but just take your fat ass to the BART and use the walk as an excuse to buy a horchata latte AND SOME MEXICAN FOOD.  You're welcome.
author: Herman T.

description:
A friend of mine has been posting pictures on IG of her Horchata Frappe, and I was like "Where did you get that!!!!?"  She told me Tierra Mia.  They are located in San Francisco, Oakland and down in  Los Angeles.  Since I live near SF this was my destination.  I hit up a different friend of mine and asked, "Hey would you be interested in trying an Horchata Frappe?" He said yes.

The Mission cafe isn't too far of a walk from the 24th Bart station.  Since I was travelling back to the Peninsula I brought a travel mug with me and they filled it up, no problem.  The Horchata Frappe was just right, not too sweet or plain, the perfect amount of flavor.

The shop is cute, located on a corner.  They have outdoor seating as well as indoor.  I am for sure going back here to try more of their drinks.
author: Michelle M.

description: Really polite and my horchata latte was amazing. Was a really laid back environment, but also like upbeat because the barisstas were having such a good time. Definitely recommend if you live in the area.
author: Amanda V.

description: The drinks here are great, but i was disappointed by most recent visit. I ordered a vanilla latte, which ended up being just syrup and milk. I regretfully didn't taste my drink until I was already on my way home. $5 plus tip for steamed milk was a bit irritating.
author: Jameace M.

description:
Cute little coffee shop with tons of choices and decent amount of seating. 

Really solid wifi and comfortable seating for studying, working on projects, reading, etc.

Biggest downside would be that they close pretty early, especially if you wanna burn any midnight oil working on said project.
author: Daniel Z.

description:
I like the Horchata Latte a latte.  

It was sweet but not too sweet.  I'm not sure if it would've been sugar overload as I only took a sip and my friend finished the rest but she seemed to enjoy it.
author: Linda N.

description: One of the best spots for a good sweet and delicious coffees. I'm from south cali and I was really excited to see a Tierra Mia in San Fran. It's a must stop coffee shop.
author: Mayra A.

description:
I love the Mexican mochas here, not to sweet and just the right amount of spice.
The cafe is always so nice and clean as well.
I was always worried about finding parking in the morning as I pass by, but there's plenty of street parking on valencia street.
Come inside and enjoy a cup of joe.
author: Luisa M.

description:
Latte lovin'.

My friend and I dropped by on a Sunday morning for caffeine and a catch-up. They seem to be well-known for their lattes, both coffee- and tea-based. I ordered their COCO LOCO LATTE, $3.95 for a small, which is imbued with tones of creamy coconut and is reported to be less sweet than their horchata latte. My friend got their HONEY VANILLA TEA LATTE, $3.95 for a small, which she asked to be half sweet. Still delicious.

As for the space, Tierra Mia has both indoor and outdoor seating surrounded by plentiful windows. Gotta love natural lighting! The noise level is quiet, and I don't recall any background music, which meant my loud voice had tons of space to play.

The only downside? Struggling to carry your full cup o' latte back to your table without spilling ;)

Till next time, Tierra Mia!
author: Adele F.

description: Omfg this place is so fucking good!!!! After being lost in san Francisco i was in desperate need of a refreshment.Thankfully i found this place. This hot awesome guy by the name of Matthew took my order and made my drink.His warm smile, beautiful dimples,and gorgeous hair just made my day. He truly is an angel in disguise plus his fashion choice was super on point. The horchata frapp i ordered was sooooo bomb and good. I am so glad i found this place.
author: Lydia T.

description: This place is down the street from my house, they have a few latte's that you probably will not find at other places. It's really not that bad.
author: Jorge P. G.

description:
My weekly escape from foggy Inner Sunset has bought Tierra Mia Caffe for some leisurely reading and light work. Sunshine in Bernal Heights/Noe Valley area never disappoints. 

Parking was easy to find. The cafe's decor is spacious and clean with a noticeable latino influence. I personally really like it because it reminds me of LA. Decent number of outlets. Strong wi-fi. Lots of seating options: couches, tables, and bar. 

I got the Mexican Mocha Frappe because I was told that iced wasn't an option. It's pretty delicious. Loved the spice. It is a little more sweet then ideal, but not a deal breaker. 

I'm planning on coming back trying the latte version of the mexican mochan and also the horchata latte.
author: Steven P.

description: I like what they stand for quality and sustainably rooted coffee resources. Nice quiet and calm atmosphere. A lot a room to sit. I wouldn't take children here since there is a lot of people working on their laptop or reading. The staff there is not overwhelming (& fake happy). I got a horchata frappe. It was perfectly blended and I'm hella picky about that! I wouldn't come back regularly since I'm more of a tea person, but I definitely recommend to try.
author: Bianca Z.

description: The iced horchata latte is delicious, and they have decaf espresso. :) Very spacious and comfy, not too crowded like every Philz branch I've been to. I think the highest compliment is when you not only liked a place, but also you would actually go back to it or frequent it regularly. I'm definitely going to Tierra Mia as much as possible while I'm still in San Francisco, and I'll come back to it again whenever I visit San Francisco in the future.
author: Janet L.

description:
Yet another gem in the neighborhood. Tierra Mia has a big store front window on Mission Street, yet you might still miss it if you walked past, because of its modest colors and decors. Stepping in, you're greeted by a large but cozy space, with lots of seating (bar, stools, and sofa) and a menu of mexican fusion coffee (horchata latté, mexicano mocha, etc.. all above $3.5 of course..) as well as pour overs.

I went for the mexicano mocha ($4) which was awesome, i would have added another shot of espresso to it though since i'm a coffee lover. they did tone down the sugar for me, which allowed the spices to stand out a little more. I was a little overwhelmed by the amount of milk in there, so later I did go for another shot of espresso, but they charged us $2.5 for that shot, since it was not ordered with the drink.. so.. meh. lol.

Drawn by the pastry window, I also asked about where they source their baked goods; turns out it's from this french baker in Oakland, who used to have his own bakery, but now he just delivers fresh pastry to coffee shops around SF. I forgot the name, but the guava danish (~$) was delicious!

Would definitely be back again because of its spacious seating and warm staff, but I'm a little held back about the coffee, might just try cappuccino next time.
author: Maggie G.

description: You'll pay $8.50 for an apple turnover and a large coffee, and you'll wait 10 minutes for your hand-brewed cup.  The wait is worth it - a very good cup of coffee- but the pastry is meh and the staff is not friendly. Quite overpriced, in my opinion.
author: Matthew L.

description:
This was a recent discovery for me by some friends in Orange County. The closest one is roughly 15 miles from me. So I took advantage of being within a 5 mile radius of this place! My FAVE is the Rice & Beans frappe!! It is what it sounds like it is; horchata blended w/coffee and espresso beans, topped off w/cinnamon and possibly laced crack.. I don't care I'm  still sipping.  

This location is a lot (emphasis), nicer than the one I have been to in LA county.  Very spacious, great seating arrangements and a cute patio out back so you can enjoy the bay breeze.  You have to try Tierra Mia!
author: Mary Ann C.

description: I love this place! I end up here whenever I arrive early for a doctor's appointment next door, and it's so comfy, clean and peaceful. The Peets at the doctor's building is AWFUL - - -Everything tastes burned!  Come here instead and sit in a nice chair, have a perfect drink and get some work done :-)
author: Jeri B.

description:
A super late review and It's not that often that I do a review but for Tierra Mia it is a MUST!

I have to thank James & his coworkers from the bottom of my Corazón for all their help and kindness towards my Fiancé and I.
We had our Engagement Photoshoot with our photographer on Sunday the 28th of May and our first stop was Tierra Mia.
This little coffee shop is so important to My fiancé and I since this was where we had our first official date many Lunas ago! 
Not only did they allow us to take pics at the cafe, they were completely OK with letting our Photographer move their furniture decorations and cafe equipment around so she could get the most perfect shots!
Aside from the kindness of the baristas, the CAFE is the best ever! 

Again, I thank you Tierra MIA!
Blessings!
author: C_issa R.

description:
This place is such a hidden gem! It's right there but it's not so obvious and in your eyes. May be that's what makes it special. Perfect corner location with a small outdoor patio. The inside is super nice and welcoming. Pretty spacious compared to typical coffee shops. With a very nice decor focusing on their theme of Latin American coffees. They also have a nice bar seating. This place feels perfect when you just want to step in and rewind or cut yourself out. Soft music good, coffees, and you are free to choose your pace. Sit back and relax or crank those work emails out when you are working from "home"
Oh talking about their coffee. They have a really good selection. Ok may be I'm biased since i like their mochas. Definitely recommend trying the Mocha Mexicano. That extra bit of spice makes it really nice! The baristas are friendly and welcoming as well.

Haven't tried the other stuff on their menu yet. But definitely coming back here for the horchata latte and the Mexican hot chocolate. May be one of those foggy and not so warm mornings in SF!
author: Vikram C.

description: The coffee selection is great! Service was friendly, but I came here to enjoy a cup of coffee and read for a bit. I wasn't able to have an enjoyable experience because the workers were gathered around at a table and talking really loud (sometimes yelling/chanting) and discussing work things out in the open. I'll be back for coffee, but taking it to go.
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
Came in early on a Sunday hoping for a quick coffee and pastry run. Got the ham and cheese croissant, which was great (esp. heated up), and ordered a "small cafe au lait." My interaction with the barista followed:

Barista: Would you like your milk steamed for that cafe au lait?
Me: Yes...isn't that what you do for a cafe au lait?
Barista: Some people just pour in cold milk.

I've never been asked that question, since my understanding of a cafe au lait (in American cafes at least) was that it was coffee with steamed milk. Otherwise, I'd order a coffee and pour the milk in myself? That aside, I found out my small cafe au lait came in a larger cup and was still $5, even when I asked to clarify that it was a small I ordered. 

Overall: The shop is cute, I'd probably have to give their specialty lattes a fair try, but it's a little too pricey for a small morning cup of coffee!
author: Cindy S.

description: Best horchata coffee!! Ordered an iced horchata latte with soy milk, super delicious.
author: Christina S.

description: Awesome place with comfortable seating. So far I've tried the Horchata Frappe and the Mocha Mexicano - both were excellent. Pricing is similar to Philz and a little pricier than Starbucks, but it's worth it.
author: Jon E.

description:
SUCKA FOR FLAVORED LATTES!

I am a cafe dweller. Those kind of people who chill at cafés and read, study, surf, and people watch. 

Always drove by this cafe and liked how they have a little cute outside area away from the sidewalk. Needed to place to "study" for a couple hours with good lattes.

1. Place isn't overly packed. Several places to grab a seat near plugs.
2. Not a loud place, individuals doing work on laptops. Great place to focus. 
3. Free wifi (and clean bathroom)
4. Good beans. Flavored lattes!!! 
5. Great location. Good natural lighting, semi decent street parking. Close to restaurants if hungry. 

COCOLOCO LATTE - sweet latte with nice notes of coconut. No need to add sweetener, it's sweat enough. 

WILL I BE BACK? yes indeed. I have to try their Cuban con Leche latte and Horchatta latte. 

JABA APPROVED. Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
I haven't written a review in a looong time but I feel compelled to do so today! I met a couple of life-long girlfriends here today. Upon walking in, I was surprised how nice the cafe was! The Horchata Latte was bomb! My girlfriends raved about the Apple Tart and Mexican Mocha! Gooooood eats!

Tierra Mia is probably the most unassuming coffee spot! I would have never expected the quality of product, especially the decor, to have come from that corner of Mission and Valencia Streets! Perhaps I expected something more along the lines of the Burger King and Acme Surplus stores directly across the street! None the less, go in and check it out!
author: Candy R.

description:
Good coffee spot; I was actually more impressed with the location. It seems like a fantastic work spot...super bright and space to work.

The only reason this isn't a 5-star review is because their syrups are Monin not their own creation.  Other than that, my almond milk latte tastes great.  Could have been foam owe/thicker but at least it didn't taste burned! I'll def be back.
author: Monica J.

description:
Do you know what liquid crack tastes like? Nope, me neither!!...but I'd imagine it would taste something like Tierra Mia's horchata latte frappe. Hot diggity dog. A little sweet, a lot creamy, and horchata-y topped with plenty of whip and cinnamon. Liquid crack or heaven in a cup. Seriously. My only suggestion? Don't get the small. According to my girlfriends, the Mexican chocolate latte frappe is even better! Whaaat?!? No way! Husband thoroughly enjoyed his coffee too (and they rotate plenty of excellent coffees).

Thankfully located in Bernal Heights where it is far less hairy than the rest of San Francisco, Tierra Mia is easy to access (at the corner of Valencia St & Mission St). Street parking is plentiful within a block radius and the coffee shop is really cute - lots of LA-Latino tribute art and plenty of seating. They even have a miniature fenced in park (a parklet?) with a few tables out on the patio.

A required stop to and from the city!!
author: Jan P.

description:
Horrible service!!!!
 I walked in and was craving their yummy drink and the barista tells me no espresso drinks. Mind you they hadn't closed yet. What else would their be? I was frustrated and decided to leave and she still has the audacity to say " we're open at 7:00 am"
Horrible customer service. Please do ale thing about it
author: Dina H.

description:
My nephew and I are huge fans of their horchata frappe.
We were introduced to this coffee shop in socal and are glad there is one up north. Too bad there is not one in San Jose but I love that this place gets me out to the city more often!
author: Mariaysabel L.

description: The best hot chocolate in the city and a comfortable nice little place to hang out.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Great wi-fi. Great coffee. 

Personal favorites: horchata latte and chai tea latte.

On the border of Mission and Bernal Heights, this is a great place to get work done for a few hours.
author: Alice H.

description:
Upscale-ish sweet coffee shop in Bernal Heights

The inside is very, very, well decorated, compared to other coffee shops in the area. There's a little yard in the back, with a tree to block out the sun, and there's outside seating next to the entrance as well.

The coffee is too sweet for me. They had ~5 kinds of iced coffee, and I ordered the first one on the list, hoping it would be the most basic version (Horchata), but it ended up being a very sugary frappuccino-style drink. All the iced coffees come with whipped cream (which thankfully I asked to NOT have while ordering), which just goes to show how this place specializes in sweet, thick coffee.

The hours are also very early. I tried to visit this place several times before, and it's always "closing time", so the time window for visiting is very small. Not a really good place to sit and surf the net--before you know it, the place is closing, and you'll have to find another coffee shop
author: Henry L.

description:
Ordered 2 Large brew coffees....instead we got a shot of expresso thrown in a cup of hot water! 

Not exactly brew coffee....."Hot water with expresso shot" was mediocre, at best!

Wasted precious time and mileage to try this joint....wouldn't recommend it!
author: JC M.

description:
Finally got to visit this place on our way to a Giants game. After hearing about all the hype, this was definitely worth the drive!

I ordered the horchata frappuccino and this thing was amazeballs!!! There are only a handful of locations so if you are up for the drive please make a trip. Nice atmosphere and great wifi. : )
author: Steven M.

description:
Not long ago, I was first introduced to the Horchata Frappe by one of my colleagues, who bought one and offered me a sip. Normally I am not much into the Frappe drinks including the popular Starbucks' version. I was amazed on how the blended beverage tasted and in all desperation; I needed to buy one for myself. 

She told me where she got it from. And I did not know there was a Tierra Mia Coffee shop in San Francisco. The Latino coffee chain is based out of Los Angeles. Many yelpers from So-Cal raved about this coffee chain.  So I had to pay this coffee house a visit. 

Finding this chained coffee house was not a problem. It is located on Mission and Valencia near Bernal Heights. When I got there, I saw a good vibe from this place. I did ordered that Medium Horchata Frappe. For $3.95, you get the Horchata beverage with some caffeine and ice blended in a loud blender until the entire combine ingredients incorporate all together with a cloud of whipped cream and a touch of cinnamon on top.  I actually like this drink. This is a blended beverage you do not find anywhere. I also ordered a small Palmier cookie for $.50. My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/tierra-mia-coffee-san-francisco?select=1oHQtOcem9MBZrBvN1ifoA#IAC-Ubx-2WEwaH2nhzvPzA

As I was sipping on my beverage, I was enjoying the shop's upbeat Latin tunes. Sitting in those comfortable couches have a nice feel. I was watching the friendly baristas preparing the house coffee, one drip at a time. I might come back and try the coffee in the morning. 

I am on the Tierra Mia Coffee bandwagon. I believe the hype.
author: Matt G.

description:
I came to know about horchata frap from my yelp buddy Matt G. I had to get my hands on one! 

The place is located on the corner of mission street. Somewhat difficult to find parking. Have quarters in handy or pay by phone to the meters. The shop has comfortable couches & chairs to hang out. Except there are flies wandering around by the door. Everything else looked clean & tidy. 

I got a small horchata frap and it was enough for me. It was a bit too sweet for my taste especially since I'm a sucker for sweets. Im sure other people would love horchata frappe, but for me trying horchata frappe once is good enough for me. It also tasted like coffee without the caffeine coffee high.
author: Kathleen U.

description:
Lots of seats and tables, all of which are clean including the two couches. Few outlets and closes a bit early, but great space with private outdoor seating as well.

Their horchata latte was excellent.
author: Topher C.

description: You had me at horchata latte! This is a cute coffee shop with friendly workers who took the time to explain their different drinks to me. Definitely a must visit in SF. They have another location in So-Cal too.
author: Steph F.

description:
I have tried the places in L.A. and I was so happy that the Mission has Tierra Mia. I got the Horchata Frapp, and it was perfect since it was a hot day. 

It might be too sweet for some, but I have a sweet tooth, so I did not mind it.
author: Mayra E.

description: Horchatta anything here is good! Whether it be in a hot or cold latte, frappe or creme. The best! So addicting and the fact that it is right around the corner from my job is a big plus! Staff is always super friendly and always remember your name.
author: Soraya M.

description: Stopped by on our way back to San Jose. Found them on Yelp after driving around a bit. Nice and clean place. Friendly staff and relatively good coffee. Tried their espresso. Little option on pastries, or at least when we visited which was around 4 on Saturday. Relax ambient, good for studying or getting work done and meeting with friends.
author: Saleh R.

description:
Upon my first sip of Tierra Mia's iced horchata latte, I knew I was entering  - in the words of Lady GaGa - a "bad romance." I am in love with this concoction and I now know I got it bad and that ain't good. The latte is a bit on the sweet side. The espresso and milk still shines through despite the prominent flavor of cinnamon (and presumably rice). I've also tried their espresso and though I've had better, it's still pretty delicious. They have blended ice drinks as well (frappes) and of course, pastries like ham and cheese croissants, palmiers, cookies, etc. 

The place is very warmly decorated with rich hues of brown, cushy leather seating, victorian lamps, and several sturdy tables to do some work, catch-up with a friend, or get lost in a newspaper (yes, some people still read print papers!) or a book (another dying diversion). Despite Tierra Mia being known as a coffee shop grassroots-founded by Latina/os (I first heard about Tierra Mia living in LA's San Gabriel Valley), this location draws in a diverse clientele. I've seen young college students, families, older gay couples, and middle-aged women across racial background hanging out. That's very refreshing and welcomed! The cafe is also surrounded by glossy photographs of coffee fields, crops, and workers who provide the product we enjoy so much --- coffee! 

The baristas are quite friendly and it seems the staff have a great rapport with each other. They are jovial, personal (OK. I may have eavesdropped in a couple of their conversations. Come on. It's a coffeehouse!), and helpful. And while I've listed a handful of praises, one final praise: Tierra Mia pipes in some awesome Spanish music... Gypsy Kings, Celia Cruz, cumbia, salsa, Tejano, and rock en espanol. As a native Angeleno, I have to say I feel quite at home here. Though I live quite far from Tierra Mia, I will have to make this one of my go-to spots. Te amo, Tierra Mia.
author: James Z.

description:
Delicious treats!! Amazing coffee and pastries at Tierra Mia! I love the service and the baristas make all my favorites!! 

$3.95 for a cafe Cubano like the ones back home in Miami!!

$3.95 Horchata Latte Mmm Mmm good!!!!

Definitely coming back!
author: Char K.

description:
To die for Horchata frapps & lattes. Thats all ive ever tried... its literally that good! Its sweet but not overwhelming. The cafe is huge, clean and peaceful. I love coming here just to destress and enjoy a nice cup of coffee 
Btw- parking may be difficult as you have to park on the street, no lot or garage.
author: Regina R.

description:
Two words: horchata frappe.

Aside from the free wifi and ample seating, their horchata frappe with whipped cream is what keeps me coming back here. Try it - you won't be disappointed! Promise.
author: Stephanie C.

description: This is a cute coffee shop with vintage decor and  ample indoor/outdoor space. I came here on a Sunday evening with bunch of friends. The staff is very friendly and will even make good recommendation on their coffee - if you love mexican coffee drinks, you can't go wrong with their Mexican Mocha and Mexican Hot Chocolate. Their freshly brewed coffee tastes great. Definitely good spot whether to hangout with friends and have coffee, work, or just sit and relax with a book.
author: Shweta S.

description:
Walked over from Downtown which is really far if you ask me.  This coffee shop had soft openings Sat 6/29/13 & Sun 6/30/13 with grand opening Mon 7/1/13.  It's at Mission near Valencia where it intersects!

I got Horchata Frappe medium reg price $3.95, but I got it FREE.  It's way too sweet & comes with whipped cream which I noticed until after I got it - had to have it removed because I don't like whipped cream.

Tierra Mia Specialities are:
Horchata Latte $3.45/3.95/4.75
Mocha Mexicano
Coco Loco Latte
Cafecito Cubano Con Leche

I saw a few pastries, but didn't ask where they are getting it.

Nice space, friendly staff.  Will be back to try more drinks in the future.

Hrs: 6:30am-10pm Daily
author: Ann L.

description: The very best in San Francisco cafes located in the Mission District superb service. Nice place to do work and hang out under the Bay area sunshine.
author: Muerto D.

description:
Love this coffee house; their service and coffee is consistent, which is important to me. My Partner and I come here at least once a week to get our usual - cafécito Cubano con leche and a soy latte: they are always to die for! 

This place is worth the drive!
author: Stacy V.

description:
I've been wanting to come here since i started going to st Luke's last year.  However, i decided to wait a bit since i was watching my diet during pregnancy.  Then on my discharge day after giving birth,  i walked  to this cafe to finally get my reward.  
This place was avidly really near the hospital.  Didn't realize it was that close.  It's a nice clean ambience.  I ordered the horchata frappe.  If you're a fan of sweet stuff,  it's good.  I liked it and something i would drink as a sweet treat not an everyday thing.  Would like to come back to try their hot coffee.
author: Claire J.

description: very chill coffee place with comfortable couch and free wifi. Coffee is nice as well.
author: Yizhou W.

description:
This place is just as good as I remember it from almost 2 years ago. I ordered the rice and beans frappe (a staff favorite)... delicious! So many flavors in one (horchata, coffee, cinnamon, mocha) it was overwhelming at first, but didn't disappoint. It was mixed just right, nothing clumpy.

Staff was very friendly and readily offered drink suggestions. Definitely a great spot to get away from the traditional hipster joints!
author: Josh L.

description: I go here for one thing only. Their famous Horchata FRAP, u cannot miss this Gem in the city.
author: Justin A.

description: Excellent service and the ladies behind the counter were chill, got the horchata frappe highly recommended this place.
author: Nate N.

description:
I liked the relaxing ambience with light to snazzy mexican music, a couple of plush sofas with low tables, tables indoors and outdoors and even seats near the coffee "bar" in the clean sunlit coffee-smelling cafe with art decor even towards the hallway towards the clean well-stocked bathroom (which you could open by getting the key from the clerk).

I LOVE Starbucks frapps. A lot of coffee places serve really bitter coffees, but their starbucks-like frappuccinos had a lot of whip cream and looked and tasted fabulous. They even have some pastries for sale as well as a wide selection of coffees/teas/smoothies and even mexican flavored coffees/drinks.

The ladies serving and making the coffee are very hospitable and friendly.  Their wi-fi is free and there are many electrical outlets to plug your laptop into.

There's really no parking unless you count the nearby Burger King as one or street parking.  The 14 bus stops nearby. They accept CC.

They close at 5pm so that's a downside to coming here vs a more late night cafe like Starbucks where you can get more laptop work done.  But unlike a Starbucks where their coffee lines can literally take hours to be small enough before you want to wait in them to order, tierra's order lines usually don't go beyond 2 people or so.

I give it a 5 since I think it rivals a Starbucks or other good cafes in terms of coffee quality and hospitality and I know I would be more than willing to come back even though they close early since they are closer to my neighborhood.
author: Frugal C.

description: Delicious coffee shop! Must have their horchata frap!!
author: Alejandra S.

description:
The service: LACKING

I worked as a barista for over a year so I'm generally very sympathetic towards baristas especially when there are only two behind the counter and they have to work through a rush.  However, when I walked in, there was no line.  No drinks where being made or back ordered. The two baristas were just talking to each other and completely disregarded me when I walked up to the counter.  Okay fine, maybe they were having an off day.  

The Horchata latta caught my eye as I love espresso and I love horchata. what a fantastic combination!  I asked about it- how many shots go in a medium, how do they make it, is it very sweet, etc.  I love coffee, I know it's a drag to talk about menu items, but this was my first time here, I was curious.  I got one word answers.  Fine, I stopped asking questions, placed my order, and sat down. 

The Horchata Latte: 
It wasn't hot- it wasn't hot, wasn't cold, just kind of perfectly warm, but I prefer my espresso drinks blistering hot.  My fault, I didn't specify that when I ordered.  I, personally, find this drink too sweet for my taste as I generally enjoy the bitterness of coffee but, that being said, it is a fantastic drink.  I'd highly recommend it to any coffee drinkers with a sweet tooth.  Espresso and horchata meld very well together.  

The setting: 
The cafe itself is very cute, spacious, and clean.  There are outlets, wifi, couches, tables, everything you'd need when coming to a cafe to read, hang out, work, whatever.  The pastry case was very tempting- I saw a card for guava and cheese pastries which are my favorite but sadly they were out. Next time.  

Overall, I'd recommend this cafe.
author: Ashley A.

description:
Woah - So, I've enjoyed going to the Echo Park location in SoCal where I am originally from. But, this location is a 5star! They have WiFi and very comfortable and welcoming spots to enjoy a nice frappe or coffee!
It's the place tom some on a rainy day and read a book or do some homework. There isn't real 'food' but pastries and coffee - a true coffee joint. Just bring snacks ;)
Sweet staff too!
author: Albia C.

description: Great service coffee was excellent love the taste and it woke me up the whole day that's what I need it will visit again with more time also already told my friends to go there.
author: Rigoberto S.

description:
So glad that there's a little piece of LA in the bay. 
Love their horchata cream and horchata frappe as well  as their horchata latte.
author: Heejin L.

description: So it says they close at 5 and we got here at 4:50. The guy refused to make a Cafe Cubano and was extremely rude. Totally different vibe than the one in Oakland. I wonder if the owner knows his employees are refusing customers.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Two words: Horchata Frape

You'll thank me later. 

By far the best blended coffee drink I've ever had.
author: Sami L.

description:
Their coffee and drinks are amazing! If you like Starbucks frappuchinos, I'd definitely recommend the rice and beans frappe (horchata = rice and cocoa = beans), cafe corazon frappe if you really like coffee, and the horchata frappe. I haven't tried the others, but I'm sure they're just as delicious. Their brewed coffee is also terrific! As for pastries, I've tried the chocolate croissant and guava cheese (please, must try! - warmed!) Amazing. I love it here!

PS - I just ordered their much raved about horchata latte. I'm in heaven.
author: Nicole F.

description:
Pros: This is the best tasting coffee in La Lengua. It is not bitter at all. 

Cons: There is a lot of turnover of staff. it does not open until 8am so does not work for me in the morning.

Other: Although it is not the hippest place, there are plenty of tables to sit at and they have free wi-fi. I am surprised this place is not more popular considering the quality of the coffee.
author: j-lo G.

description:
Mama Mia.

O Sole Mia (I know it's Mio but bear with me).

The name of Marsellus Wallace's wife in Pulp Fiction is Mia.

The name of my friend's daughter is Miako, but her nickname is Mia.

So besides the alluring name of the place, Tierra Mia offers a refreshingly sweeter take on espresso drinks that surprisingly doesn't border on the ridiculous.

Their horchata latte was a bit on the sugary side at first and so the barista made me a less sweetened version (for free!) and told me I could always request their specialty drinks less sweet.

Overall, I wouldn't say I'm a fan just yet, but Tierra Mia is more than just okay, so 3.5 stars rounded up.

For my next visit, I'm looking forward to try either their cafe cubano or the hot chocolate.
author: Dan B.

description:
HORCHATA LATTE!

This review is solely based on the horchata latte and ambiance as I was equally impressed with both. Absolutely creamy and flavorful latte that keeps you longing for more. And the ambiance is modern, open and spacious. It makes for the perfect spot to catch up with a friend or to cuddle up with a book on a fine Sunday afternoon. Their couches are actually super comfy for the latter. 

What a great find in Bernal - definite must-try for neighborhooders and explorers alike. 

Happy Drinking, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
R.I.P. Way Out Café. Tierra Mia has taken over the funky Way Out Café space and remodeled it. The funkiness is gone. The free wi-fi is also no more.

Tierra Mia, which is based in LA, roasts its own beans and has a Latin café feel with lively, melodramatic Spanish language music, pictures of coffee plantations in Latin America, and old coffee equipment on display. They have pour over coffee, espresso drinks and specialty drinks (e.g., horchata latte, Cubano con leche) and a limited selection of pastries (croissants, cake, danish, cookies, etc.). Drinks can be made with whole milk or soy (they don't have nonfat or lowfat milk). 

* Panama pour over small coffee($3): Too sour, has complex notes, chocolatey, kinda woodsy 
* Ham & cheese croissant: warmed up, big and tasty, soft, would prefer something crispier
author: Lolia S.

description:
4 stars only because I have gotten some not so nice customer service from certain employees. However the manager that comes in from LA every month or so, I didn't catch her name but she was so lovely and very cute, she makes up for the other mediocre customer service skills. She made me feel like she was happy to take my order and make my drink. I've never experienced this type of service here before. 
Everything is delicious,  I originally thought I'd love the horchata latte or frappe but turns out I'm more of a Mexican chocolate drinker, the frappe w/ a shot or 2 of espresso is bomb! Also the cafe cubano tho! Take a hit of that and you'll be coming back for more. 
All in all, I love the latin culture menu and it is a real treat to have one here in the mission.  I heard the oakland location is always busy, gotta check it out one day.
author: Ada L.

description:
This place is awesome. The barista asked me if it was my first time having coffee here (which it was) and she gave me three options of popular coffees she thought I would like. I ordered the Gautamalen blend I believe and was amazed that they make each cup with the pour over method.

When my coffee was ready, the barista asked me to try it first without cream. I am usually a cream and honey in my coffee type of gal, but I took her suggestion and the coffee stood alone. It was really great coffee, gave me a great energy buzz and I stayed here way too long using their wifi on my computer. Great place.
author: Christine E.

description:
I am swooning over the Horchata latte. It's a sweet espresso and sugar hot cup with the creamy deliciousness that most resembles a chai latte. But with espresso!

Free wifi. Super clean and pristine interior. Classiest coffee shop with a simple menu of pour over coffee and latte options. Pastries. Calming yet upbeat Spanish music. Sofas. Tables- short and tall. 

Great place for business meetings. While still being a neighborhood coffee shop.
author: Regina D.

description:
OK, I fell in love with Tierra Mia Coffee when I first visited their LA locations, but I am a little worried about its success in San Francisco for the following reasons:

1. Sweet Coffee/Tough Competition - I consider Tierra Mia more of a treat versus a necessity during my day. I absolutely love their Horchata Latte and the Rice and Beans Frappe, but I would say that they don't provide me with the caffeine needed for the day, for sure sugar intake. I've yet to try a traditional latte here so I will update my review once I do ! Furthermore, Blue Bottle, Ritual, Philz are all not in LA. They also all offer non-fat milk/2%, which is a big deal here in healthy conscious San Francisco.

3. Location - Its not BART accessible! I really wish this place could be more centrally located, further up Valencia or Mission St. There is not alot of foot traffic in this area.

I am a loyal fan and will continue to make the drive out there, I just hope other people do the same so this place can stay!!! 

Love you TMC!!!
author: Susana M.

description: The Horchata Latte's are amazing. The space is lovely and well kept.
author: Preet S.

description: So glad I tried this place out, I will definitely be coming back. Had a ham and cheese croissant, which was excellent: buttery, flaky, and high quality cheese. I paired it with one of their specialties, an amazing horchata latte. It was the perfect level of the creaminess and sweetness I would expect from a drink like this, and it wasn't so hot that I had to wait for it to cool before I could start sipping. I highly recommend it.
author: Dani S.

description:
Horchata frappe is the best thing ever. Wish I would have ordered a bigger size. 
Also, the young ladies working here are keeping the store and their work area very clean.
author: Brooke F.

description: The horchata latte was amazing!! The loco coco is a coconut mojito flavor. I think I would prefer coconut latte without mojito. Overall yummy, great prices, nice interior, dog friendly
author: Andrea R.

description: Nice quiet coffee shop near Mission District.   By no means am I a coffee snob, but I would like to think I know a good cup of coffee.   Visited this place a couple times during our atay in San Francisco and was very pleased with their Mexican inspired coffees.
author: Juan E.

description: This is probably my favorite coffee spot. Highly recommend it... an horchata latte a must!
author: Álex T.

description: First of all, I am not a coffee fan at all. But- whenever I do want some coffee, this is the spot. I really recommend the Horchata Frap, its delicious! Their pastries are also really good, try the guava one.
author: J P.

description:
Latin Couture Coffee At Its Finest!!!!

Since I was turned on to Tierra Mia I have been addicted! With being all over the Bay Area, it feels good to be able to walk into my coffee shop and the baristas still know my name (not to mention ask me where I've been)!!

They have the bomb.com Horchata Latte and Frappe!!! No comparison (and competition) out there!!! Coupled with the great ambiance of Latin old town and the great, friendly coffee makers...you just can't beat it!!!

They have a second Tierra Mia in Oakland but nothing beats SF!

Thanks Tierra Mia SF!!!
author: Kia B.

description: Lovely cafe in European style with some comfy chairs, fresh coffee and beautiful people. I had a Mexican mocha and I really like it as it had just a right amount of sugar/honey in it. I would definitely choose this place for my next girl get together chat.
author: Ilmia N.

description:
When I was in college, my mom sent me a book called the 'Checklist Manifesto' that I flipped through while sipping coffee in Chicago. Ever since, a certain kind of coffee shop triggers a pavlovian response in which I start getting shit done. This is one such coffee shop.

Tierra Mia has a great italian, granite coated interior that is the antithesis to the other understated coffee shops in the area. Its metaphorical tie and suit tails puts me in a work state that leaves my check lists littered with, well, checks.

To boot, they've also got great expresso beans and, if you're feeling frivolous, a killer Horchata Latte. I don't know myself, but my roommate swears by their chocolate croissants as well.

Eat well, enjoy the space, and burn through some pencil lead.
author: Sajid R.

description: Horchata latte tastes amazing, even if it's just an overload of cinnamon sugar in a latte. It does the trick! Pastries are HUGE. I ordered a ham & cheese croissant in the morning and ended up eating the other half for lunch. A lot of seating indoor and a few tables outside so plenty of seating options.
author: Maryann S.

description:
My  husband and I love this place. Great coffee and delicious pastries. I'm obsessed with the guava cheese one. I dream about it! The interior is nicely done and they play music at just the right volume. A few people come here with laptops and it seems to be a nice place to work. I regret not coming here when I worked from home because it seems like a chill place. Despite being a bespoke coffee house, it hasn't been overrun by hipsters. Not sure why, given it's location on Mission and vicinity to Valencia hotspots. 

The only negative is that because they really care about your coffee, it does take a while to get it. An iced coffee took about 6-7 minutes, which can be fine, but when there isn't much of it, waiting doesn't seem very rewarding or worthwhile. I could stand the wait if there was more coffee to enjoy afterward.
author: Amy ..

description: I never use to drink lattes or anything with coffee, but this place I love the drinks are good and you can't go wrong with whatever you order. I usally get this horchata latte but today I tried the Mexican hot chocolate and it was good
author: Sky P.

description: Omg the Horchata frapp was delicious!!! Definitely worth the drive to the city! Recommend to me by a friend recommended you to go as well.
author: Yasmin G.

description: The best coffee.. worth the drive. Loved the horchata coffee and coconut coffee. So glad we went. Thanks to our friend who recommended this place. When we visit the city. This is our first stop...
author: Sandra F.

description:
Sunday morning, my head is hurting...

okay, I won't bastardize that old Velvet Underground song any further. 

Let's be honest. After an evening of slinging back too many boozy concoctions, a gal is in need of a few things: water, coffee, and a hearty breakfast. At least Tierra Mia was able to supply me with two of those bare necessities. 

I asked what the milk options were, and the only non-dairy one was soy. I scanned their menu, but went with my standard soy latte. 

It was very rich, smooth, almost buttery tasting, with just the right amount of foam. The espresso was delicious. Very subtle. If you want your coffee beverage to have a bit more of a kick, order an extra shot or two. 

Sadly, mine was served in a to-go cup, and there was no latte art. I guess mastering the skill of steaming and serving soy takes a lot of practice. At least the flavor was there.

Teeniest tiniest con: I would have liked if the barista had asked me if I wanted my beverage to stay, but I was a bit sneezy because of my seasonal allergies, so I understand why she probably wanted me out. I also looked a bit disheveled from my late night out and about, but oh well. We can't always step out of the house looking like goddesses. Only 90% of the time. ;)
author: Brandi W.

description: huge menu, very friendly staff, I've had a latte & a macchiato caramelo, as well as an iced tea and all were perfect. There's a neat outdoor seating area, that is fenced in. The interior is really warm and welcoming too. I go here now after my visits to St. Luke's hospital to relax, makes not so fun doctors visits a little better! I wish there was one in my neighborhood, I'd go there all the time!
author: Venus S.

description: I just had a really pleasant experience! Let me recap what was awesome: the pour over Columbian coffee. I found it delicious, and they gave me a personal cream to use, all for myself. In that vein of excellent sanitation, the bathroom was very clean as well. I went back to the counter realizing I wanted a pastry, and I ordered an amazing almond croissant. Just perfect. The staff was friendly, and helpful, and all female which just added to the warm glow I was already feeling. Looking forward to my next visit~ thank you!
author: Trixie R.

description: I secretly want to write a bad review for this place so none of you will enjoy its goodness! This place shames every coffee shop I've ever been to, they have nailed the horchata frappe and their Mexican hot chocolate frappe is life changing! The second I walked in to this place they had Selena blasted on the sound system, no line and the two most quiet and polite baristas who remembered my name where I was from and what drink I liked this place has quickly become my little slice of heaven on the weekends, sad that they don't have one closer to me but well worth the drive!
author: RacheL C.

description: Tierra Mia serves the best slow drip coffee in San Francisco. The staff was extremely knowledgable and friendly. The horchata was the best adult shake I've had since the Shamrock Shake.
author: Richard W.

description: The Horchata frappe is fantastic and the cafe itself looks phenomenal.i will definitely be back to try other drinks.
author: Mike D.

description: Great environment. Good seats, wifi is decently quick. Cool vibes.
author: Omar T.

description: Try the Horchata Latte! I'm hooked and every time I'm in the mission I have to stop by and grab one!
author: Serina T.

description: I popped in the other day for a latte. I asked the lady what was her favorite one and she straight up told me "I don't know, get whatever you want" with an attitude. So I ordered a regular latte and it barely tasted like one. Please change your staff and teach them to make decent coffee. Thanks
author: asif a.

description:
This place is seriously legit. It's not your run of the mill spot. You won't find anything mass brewed here; it's all done by the cup. Most everything I've tried here tends to be deep, strong, and rich. It's obvious that they take their coffee very seriously here, as the emphasis is all about the java. The baked goods selection is minimal, and there is no prepared food. 
The horchata latte is off the hook. The coco loco latte is excellent as well.
author: Brendon S.

description:
Diamond in the rough find! 

The rice & bean (horchatta and coffee bean) frappe is SO GOOD!! Perfect on a hot day! staff are uber friendly and know their stuff which is helpful when asking for recommendations, etc. When the staff aren't helping their customers they are perfecting their brews which I think is pretty cool that they're not afraid to "waste" their ingredients but they are caring enough to make their customers happy and drinks bomb diggity.
author: Natalia H.

description:
The frappes here are outstanding. I wish the place didn't close at 4, but it's probably better for my wallet and waistline that it does. The Rice and Bean frappe is so good--has yummy, shaved espresso bean bits in it giving it a truly robust flavor. 

They also use real Abuelita in the Chocolate Mexicano Frappe putting all other mocha frappes to shame.

Always a clean, bright atmosphere with friendly baristas--a must visit for a unique, yummy coffe experience.
author: Becca L.

description: Horchata frappe was amazeballs.  Just don't pronounce it WHOREchata.  The Latin dude behind the counter doesn't appreciate it.
author: Joc V.

description:
Decided to check this place out today. I went right after lunch and there was no line. The space is really nice and the employees extremely friendly. They also have pastries from Patisserie Philippe (French bakery that used to have a cafe in SOMA). 

I had the horchata cream which was like an horchata milkshake. It was quite good. The only reason I am taking off one star is they only have whole milk or soy milk ($1 extra). It's not a big deal to me, but it is to some. They say it's because the coffee tastes better with whole milk. (I think everything probably tastes better with more fat in it.) We also got a mocha mexicana which was also good, not overly sweet with nice hints of cinnamon. I'll definitely be back.
author: Joann C.

description: There is not a lot of places that I know that I can try a horchata latte so when I heard about this place, I had to make the drive up to SF to try. The  staff was super friendly. I told them that this was our first time here and they took the time to tell us about their coffee. I had a medium horchata latte and hands down it was awesome! A little bit of a drive to get to this place, plus no free parking in the area but I see myself coming back for more since it's that good.
author: Ken L.

description:
Wandered over to this place on a Sunday evening after getting tired of all my southern california friends and family raving about it.  I am SO glad there is a location up here.

When we walked in we were greeted by super knowledgeable  baristas who asked if it was our first time since we were staring wide eyed at the menu.  She explained the different coffees and beverages and suggested some of the popular drinks.  We settled on an horchata latte and coco loco latte.  Wow, these were so amazingly delicious.  Very sweet, but such a treat.  Would I come here every day?  Probably not, but would I come up here every now and again?  Most definitely.

Something about the environment and ambiance.  I could have a nice intimate conversation or get work done.  I think its a great spot with excellent drinks!
author: Ashley Elena E.

description:
I stopped in here first while hungry and wandering around the neighborhood for the first time. 

Horchata latte or frappe is a definite MUST if you enjoy cinnamon. 

I am not a big coffee drinker, so I cannot judge based on the quality of their coffee, but that one drink may make me find excuses to stop by even though I live in the East Bay.

Also their pastries are delicious and huge.
author: Charlene B.

description:
The coffee, when it's good, is very very good, but my experience here has been inconsistent. Wait is always long. They've had to make my coffee over in two occasions, because there was a mistake.

I will chalk it up to opening pains and hope they get their process figured out, so they can be more consistent.
author: Evren O.

description: Exceptionally friendly staff and great picks for pour over coffees. Their prices were really reasonable and the vibe is welcoming but non-pretentious. You can tell that they still care about quality coffee though.
author: Lauren P.

description:
after visit to my doctor a block away, I needed to get a quick breakfast and coffee.

ordered a latte and blueberry danish.
The place was empty on my visit so I got good service.

Latte wasn't great.... check out the Peet's inside the clinic...they're better.
the danish was not good either.... mushy and it lacked flavor.
author: Learnee L.

description: Service was great and Iced Horchata latte was on hit! Can't wait to try the cubano con leche next time!
author: Jazmina F.

description:
We were lucky enough to check out Tierra Mia's first San Francisco store on a Sunday about a week and a half ago. The owner, Ulyesses, was there watching over things. It was pretty awesome to do a coffee tasting with him. He took the time to explain the different coffees and their flavours and he told us all about the company. We first discovered Tierra Mia in Los Angeles so we're stoked to see it up here. Sadly we live in Menlo Park so we can't wait to see one of their locations down here.

My favourites (blended drinks) are the Horchata Latte and Mexican Chocolate Mocha. The chocolate is so rich and flavourful. Reminds me of hot chocolate in Mexico City. Made with real milk etc. As for the "real" coffee I loved the Ethiopian. It was very fruity yet bold.

The staff has got to be the nicest team of barristas in the world. They were kind, accommodating, patient.

I loved the decor in this particular location as well. It is tasteful and unique and decorated with some wonderful antique coffee items like old grinders etc. There are also some gorgeous chandeliers which I assume are antiques. 

All-in-all an amazing coffee experience.
author: A J.

description: My regular latte wasn't too hot or too cold - just perfect! I live walking distance from here so I'll definitely be coming more often. I haven't been here on a weekday, but its space seems great for studying and is one of the nicer cafes in Bernal Heights.
author: Ava R.

description: Horchata latte w soy - yum!! Like the Latin music in background and comfy chairs too!!
author: Elana R.

description: A total devoted fan to this place. The horchata latte was just the right amount of sweet for me. I have a sugar tooth but can't stand overly sweet drinks. The flavor and latte consistency was great. No complaints. The fact that my hubby works a block from them gives me even more reason to go back and order time and time again. I have not tried any other drinks so an opportunity to try more of their items is a great plus. You got my business, Tierra Mia.
author: Ramla J.

description: Two words: Horchata Frappe!! I don't know where this has been all my life. But thank goodness I found it! Sooo good!
author: Rachel C.

description: Nice inside w space to work.  Decaf pour over completely weak and chai tea late made w teabag.  So for beverages a 1 star.
author: michael d.

description: Loved their strawberry and mango frescas! The staff is really friendly and the atmosphere is quite, ample, quiet and cozy. Definitely will be back for their horchata frappe which I should have gotten in the first place, darn!
author: Jacky H.

description: Nice location with a pleasant/relaxed atmosphere... I dont often order their hand-brewed single cup of coffee, but the Americanos are great, the Cubano will (deliciously) wake the dead and they have a great selection of tasty iced/frozen drinks to take the edge off on a warm afternoon (recommend giving one of the horchata drinks a try).  PLUS... the staff is terrific.  Knowledgeable, friendly, and they sincerely seem to enjoy their jobs and the brand.
author: Michael B.

description: The place is amazing!!! The ambiance is perfect sophis Latin American. Although, they do have Ethiopian coffee. Not to miss on the coffee and cafe beat! It may not have the best coffee in San Francisco, but the vibe of the place is worth the visit!
author: Neelam N.

description: Great customer service! However it's a bummer they close at 5pm. Aside from my service I ordered a horchata frappe and chocolate croissant which were both delicious and reasonable priced.
author: Desi M.

description: PERFECT AMERICANO !! The ladies were really nice and made it kidds temp just how I asked !! Clean and neat and such a cute place :) totally to DIIIEE FOR !!
author: Chi G.

description: The horchata frappe and horchata latte are amazingly good!!! Finding parking around this place was fairly easy. The coffee beans  are good but very little for the same price, you'd get 1/3 more at sightglass coffee.
author: Steve K.

description: I ordered and afterwards discovered that I had left my wallet at home. I told them my husband would arrive any minute and that he'd be able to pay my open bill of $3.95. They refused service. Not cool!
author: Daib S.

description: The worst customer experience I've seen in San Francisco having lived here for seven years. After ordering three drinks to go, the one woman working took an order behind me, completed that person's order, and started taking a third order. After seven minutes of waiting (I counted) she hasn't started my to go drinks. I donated ten dollars to this place because I could not wait half an hour for coffee to go. Despite living in the neighborhood I will never return.
author: i p.

description: Compra el mocha Mexicano y el cubano. 'Tan ricos! This place is fairly new and its just like the ones on LA. Im glad to see a low amount of hipsters there but like everything in the MIssion now, its gonna get gentrified. SO RUN IN THERE AND BANISH THOSE BASTARDS. NO LOS DEJES QUE TE ROBEN TU CAFE!!!
author: Erick I.

description: Fantastic! Open late (until 10pm) has WIFI and amazing drinks.. super amazing. Chill atmosphere, friendly staff, and comfortable seats!! Ordered the mocha mexicana with its cinnamon and spice notes and my gal friend had the yummy Horchata Latte-- creamy thick foam:) Delicioso!!
author: Amber M.

description: This place serves a consistently good cappuccino. I've enjoyed great coffee elsewhere, but only this place is ALWAYS good. Blue bottle, Ritual, 4 Barrel, etc. all have their good and bad days/baristas, but I walk into Terra Mia knowing I will walk out with a satisfying cup every time. Plus, there's none of the obnoxious attitude you get at other SF roasters (who must seem to think that blank stares and ironic staches somehow make for better coffee). All of the staff at Terra Mia are refreshingly sweet and fun to chat with. It's just a fantastic shop. The only drawback is the design of the place, just not so much a cozy place to hang out. But it's perfect for dropping by, chatting with the friendly baristas, and grabbing a cup to go.
author: Jamie L.

description: If you need a break from the norm come here. The place has a Latin vibe and cool drinks. Cafe Cubano, Horchatta Latte just to name a few. And the baristas wear a button down shirt and tie.
author: NeeNee D.

description:
Stopped in for the soft opening today and got a pour over iced coffee with the Panama blend.  Delicious, light and fruity -- perfect for the unseasonably warm SF weather.  Disclosure:  drink was on the house for the soft opening.  Can't beat that.

Love the spacious feel of the interior, leather chairs, warm wood trim and photo mural of coffee farms and farmers throughout Latin America.  The vibe is very SoCal -- laid back and elegant with strong Latino influences and nary a hipster in sight.  Surprisingly fantastic coffee.  Juan Gabriel playing on the speakers.  The LA girl in me felt right at home.

Feels like a place I could spend hours at.  Really hope this place takes off.  Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Coco L.

description: Awesome service and amazing coffee. Cubano con leche and mocha mexicana (haven't tried other stuff yet) are well worth the visit! We trek in from San Mateo and drop by whenever we are in the area.
author: S B.

description: came here for their grand opening! ordered the horchata frappe... SOOO GOOD!! highly recommend it! people are so friendly and the space is awesome!! you must try this place!
author: Sara T.

description: Great space and really nice bartistas. Their coffee is also really tasty and not over roasted. Ordered a decalf Americano and loved every sip! Looking forward to getting their horchata frappe next time.
author: Ericka A.

description: I went back to give their medium-dark roast a try and it was still totally sour and light.  And it was $3 for the drip coffee.  Totally not worth it, their coffees are such a sour disappointment.
author: Avi S.

description: awesomely clean and great ambiance.  Plenty of seating and very friendly staff.  I'm no coffee pro but seems like they do a good job and actually care about the history of the beans and whatnot.  I will definitely come here many times in the future.  Well done, Tierra Mia!
author: Carolyn N.

description: I came here for a quick caffeine boost on a Sunday afternoon. The place was virtually empty -- I ordered at the register and received my drink in less than 5 minutes. I was very impressed by the decor. Clean, well-kept, and well-lit, Tierra Mia also offers ample seating space and even a couch. There are panels of beautiful portraits in the back as well. I ordered the iced mocha, which had a perfect balance between the roasty espresso and the sweet chocolate. The portions are also just right and reasonably priced. I will definitely be back again to try some of their more specialty drinks, such as the iced horchata latte (thanks, fellow Yelpers!).
author: Hurnan V.

description: Hands down one of the best coffee shops in the Mission. Mexican mocha is actually made with Abuelita chocolate! Horchata latte tastes like horchata.   Their customer service is great.
author: Esmeralda R.

description: This a great place with really knowledgeable baristas.  They roast their own coffee.  Their single drip coffee was amazing.  I usually drink my coffee with cream and sugar, but I enjoyed my cup black.  Next time I go, I will try the Horchata Latte.  The space is clean and nicer than some surrounding coffee shops in the area.
author: Roman A.

description: Terrific service, great ambiance and delicious coffee! Wonderful addition to the neighborhood.
author: Samia Z.

description:
caffe cubanito...fuel for the drive up to Sactown or to jumpstart the mindflow.   brought back memories of thimbles of cubano con leche at MIA-FL x 5

i enjoy watching the barista craft my order....didn't realize they grind the raw sugar to ensure it dissolves completely into the brew...

wish they stayed open after 5pm...like they used to...
author: RJ A.

description: Update: They have almond milk now and it taste delicious with the horchata latte. I also tried the guava cheese strudel which they get from Patissierre Phillips here in SF . Pastry was fresh and savory. Still can't get enough of this place!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Driving by and discovered this gem of a coffee shop.  Excellent coffee with a Latin twist, great pastries and very friendly service.
author: Dora G.

description: Horchatta Latte whether it be hot, cold or in a Frappe form is so yummy!! The Frappes here put Strarbucks to shame! These are creamy goodness all the way to the last slurp!
author: S P.

description:
PARKING: Parking is a bit difficult to find but if you have quarters I see that the metered parking is always available. 

DRINKS: Always gotta have my Rice and Beans Frappé when coming here. Never a small always a medium and sometimes a large when I'm feeling greedy. These are sweet flavored coffee drinks so if you're looking to get more of a coffee kick than a sweet tooth fix than just ask for more espresso poured into your frappé. You can also do their other straight up espressos if that's more up your alley.

PASTRIES: I've had Tierra Mia Coffee from Los Angeles and I gotta say the pastries up here compared to down there aren't as good. The only pastry I find able to consume is their guava cheese pastry. I guess it's just the differences cultures from NorCal to SoCal.

STAFF: Very knowledgeable about the drinks they serve. Friendly and helpful in helping you make the perfect choice in beverage for the first timers. The only back fall to this is that the new staff being hired up here is new to the coffee industry and so are still young and fresh at truly understanding what good coffee is. Nonetheless there is always someone there with the longer experience to fully back up the new hires with any help possible. 

OTHER: after a sweet coffee drink there's a wide span of endless food possibilities to choose from; American, Spanish, Asian, Central American dishes, etc.
author: Joshua P.

description: Loved the latin ambiance and coffee. Great service and coffee art. Definitely will come back.
author: Luis and Yona V.

description: Super nice and peaceful setting- Extremely nice employees- Horchata Fraps the BOMB!!! Great place!
author: Kirby H.

description: Great place to get your Spanish side coffee on. Love me the Rice N Beans! Check them out when you have a chance.  Also I'm not a big coffee guy or expert and I understand living here in S.F. coffee is HUGE here but for someone looking for something sweet and tasty with a hint of coffee this is my kinda place.
author: Joshua P.

description: Baristas are much the same to Starbucks' slave-baristas. Feckless and complete disregard on making excellent slow-drip coffee. Went there once and that was it.  Jeez, cheap labor as usual, blah!
author: Pepe W.

description: every day: iced horchata latte. it's caffeinated dessert and the addiction is real! also, their ham and cheese croissants are a good quick breakfast. all the staff are pleasant and don't give my any guff for my modified coffee orders. the environment is kinda stale but the couches are comfy and the wifi is free. anyways, i love that they're half a block away.
author: Baroness M.

description: I love this place! Great service and really cool choice of drinks. I had the Mocha Mexicano...delicious! The Horchata Latte was delicious, so was the Carmel Macchiato Latte...so good! The décor is clean, welcoming and warm. The staff are always genuinely welcoming.
author: Miss P.

description: The reason I gave them 1 star is the WIFI sucks.. They tell you they have WIFI, but  if you have an apple computer  apparently some days it will work and some days it won't.  According to management they are working on getting it fixed.  If they fix it I would be more than happy to change my review to 5 stars because my coffee was good.  But given that I visited the shop to study,  being kicked off the internet multiple times made the trip a waste of time and money for me.
author: Michelle C.

description: Good varieties of coffees.  Friendly staff.  Nice, clean interior with comfortable chairs.
author: P A.

description: They may not be the fastest coffee-jockeys ever (don't be in a hurry) but the coffee is delish!  I have more mainstream tastes and they give me artisanal street cred while not being too precious. Good service and the best iced mocha ever.
author: Matthew T.

description: I love Tierra Mia it is the best coffee i have ever tried better than Starbucks!But the sad part is that the closest Tierra Mia coffee shop is more than 15 miles away. Wish they would make a Tierra Mia in Santa Clara
author: Elizabeth R.

description: As a coffee snob of the Ritual/Blue Bottle/Stumptown variety, I have been pleasantly surprised to find Tierra Mia's coffee to be of such high quality. Also, the space is quite nice ; good service. Occasionally the music is just slightly louder than it needs to be, and I wish they had some more food/snack options -- more than just sweet pastries -- but otherwise this is a fine establishment that services excellent coffee.
author: Rick S.

description: Staff are GREAT!  Super friendly, happy and informative.  Their specialty drinks (horchata latte and Mexican chocolate mocha), are too sweet for our taste, kind of like starbucks type sugar drinks.  But you can just tell them to make them less sweet.  The staff really make this place what it is!
author: Charlie S.

description: amazingly good coffee, and pastries hit the spot...YUM!!!
author: Krista R.

description: This is a good coffee shop in the outer mission. It was a great shop with good espresso and friendly barristas. The guy asked me how my espresso was and actually seemed to care.
author: Klevin D.

description: I recently tried the horchata frappe and it was so good! I didn't go into the actual shop as my friend purchased them for us, but I would recommend them to anyone who wants a refreshing drink.
author: Erica J.

description: this place is charmless. it prides itself with its lack of wifi and its uniforms and roasted beans in a smug mall cafe kinda way. the new space is not particularly inviting (though the staff were very very nice) and sitting alone in it is just a bummer. give personality a try please.
author: Pete L.
